name: eponymous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An eponymous character in a play, book, etc. has the same name as the title.
An eponymous adjective, place name, etc. is one that comes from the name of a person: Victorian, Wagnerian, and dickensian are all examples of eponymous adjectives.
